page.title: 10Housing in Hittesleigh
page.content: The variety in the housing found reflects not only the history of the area but also the character of the present population. Houses are fairly evenly distributed over the area with the exception of the wooded Yeo valley, where the absence of new housing is particularly noticeable. By far the greatest proportion consists of farmhouses and cottages dating from the 13th century and later. Constructed mainly of cob, most remain thatched: a few, such as Medlake farmhouse, have been little modernised; others rebuilt in part or entirely, largely owing to fires in the thatch.
